item.title: Sao Paulo - the city without water
item.description: Because of the draught, the water reserves of this city that uses 16.000.000 liters of water per hour, have gotten so low as to make water racioning very likely. This means one day with and the next day without water. Storing a greater quantity of water than we already do, resolves nothing in terms of learning to live with a lower water footprint.
